Wisdom: حَدُّ الْحِكْمَةِ الْإِعْرَاضُ عَنْ دَارِ الْفَنَاءِ وَالتَّوَلُّهُ بِدَارِ الْبَقَاءِ
enWisdom: The boundary of wisdom is turning away from the perishing abode [of this world] and being infatuated with the Eternal Abode [of the Hereafter]

Wisdom: الْحِكْمَةُ شَجَرَةٌ تَنْبُتُ فِي الْقَلْبِ وَتُثْمِرُ عَلَى اللِّسَانِ
enWisdom: Wisdom is a tree that grows in the heart and bears [its] fruit on the tongue

Wisdom: أَوَّلُ الْحِكْمَةِ تَرْكُ اللَّذَّاتِ وَآخِرُهَا مَقْتُ الْفَانِيَاتِ
enWisdom: The beginning of wisdom is abandoning [worldly] pleasures and its end is loathing the transitory
There is no wisdom except with safeguarding [from sin]
Wisdom has been paired with protection [from sins]
The fruit of wisdom is success

Wisdom: ثَمَرَةُ الْحِكْمَةِ التَّنَزُّهُ عَنِ الدُّنْيَا وَالْوَلَهُ بِجَنَّةِ الْمَأْوَى
enWisdom: The fruit of wisdom is disdain for the world and infatuation with the Eternal Paradise

Wisdom: الْعِلْمُ ثَمَرَةُ الْحِكْمَةِ وَالصَّوَابُ مِنْ فُرُوعِهَا
enWisdom: Knowledge is the fruit of wisdom and rightness is from its branches
Through wisdom, the veil of knowledge is removed

Wisdom: حِكْمَةُ الدَّنِيِّ تَرْفَعُهُ وَجَهْلُ الشَّرِيفِ يَضَعُهُ
enWisdom: The wisdom of a lowly person elevates him and the ignorance of a respectable person degrades him
